pullRequest.body:
Formalized question 1 of the 1982 IMO.

Made a mistake with my original PR as I made a branch from Imo1982Q3, this should be fixed now.

Fixed the domain of the function to be the positive naturals according to @vihdzp comments - took less effort than expected.

Please let me know if I have made a mistake or if there are any further comments or improvements.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

bors d+
bors d+

```suggestion
non-negative integer values. Also, for all $m$, $n$
```

```suggestion
Determine $f(1982)$.
```
There's a bunch of solutions on that website at different degrees of readability. Can you add a short summary of your own approach?

Please use `\le` (or `\leq`) inside of LaTeX blocks instead of ≤, as it won't render properly otherwise. Also, can you explain how `f 9999 = f 3333` implies `f 1980 ≥ 660`? That seems like the main idea of the problem to me.

Here's a shorter proof :)
```suggestion
  have h : f 2 = 2 * f 1 ∨ f 2 = 2 * f 1 + 1 := by rw [two_mul]; exact hf.rel 1 1
  obtain h₁ | h₂ := hf.f₂ ▸ h
  · rw [eq_comm, mul_eq_zero] at h₁
    apply h₁.resolve_left
    norm_num
  · cases Nat.succ_ne_zero _ h₂.symm
```
This adds the `Mathlib.Algebra.GroupWithZero.Defs` import. I admit the trick with `▸` is a bit cheeky; you can replace it with a `rw` if you want.
Oh nice - what does `▸` do? Is this how you 'perform' rw in a proof term? I have been wondering how to perform what I would do in a rewrite within a proof term.

The triangle `▸` is a macro for `Eq.subst`. Given `h : x = y`, `h ▸ e` will find instances of `x` in the type of `e` and replace them by `y`.

You can sometimes use it to golf proofs like this, but really, using `rw` is both more readable and robust.

```suggestion
  hf₃ : 0 < f 3
```

```suggestion
  have h := hf.rel 2 1
  rw [hf.f₁, hf.f₂, add_zero, zero_add] at h
  exact h.resolve_left hf.hf₃.ne'
```
I suspect someone will be angry at me for removing the explicit equation at `h`, so you can add it back if you want.

I will be that person. Especially in the `IMO/` folder we want to show-case polished code with an emphasis on readability instead of hyper-general hyper-golfed modular main mathlib code :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

If you prove `superadditive` first, you can instead do
```suggestion
    rw [PNat.add_coe, add_mul, PNat.val_ofNat, one_mul, add_one_mul]
    exact (add_le_add_right ih _).trans hf.superadditive
```

```suggestion
  rcases hf.rel m n with hl | hr
  · rw [hl]
  · rw [hr, ← add_zero (f n), ← add_assoc]
    exact Nat.le_succ _
```

You can rewrite this as
```suggestion
  (add_le_add hf.superhomogeneity hf.superhomogeneity).trans hf.superadditive
```
I would argue this is cleaner, but as a renowned `calc` hater I might have some bias. Feel free to use whichever.
I must say it does look cleaner, even though a tiny bit less readable.

If you want, you can more generally prove `n ≤ f (3 * n)`, like this:
```lean 4
lemma le_mul_three_apply (n : ℕ+) : n ≤ f (3 * n) := by
  rw [← mul_one (n : ℕ), ← hf.f₃, mul_comm 3]
  exact hf.superhomogeneity
```
It could be added... but I think it is a straightforward application of `superhomogeneous` don't you think?
Sure, but so is this. Proving the more general result instead shows that there's nothing special about 660 and 1980 besides one being 3 times the other.
I added it in. Thanks for reviewing Violeta (:

```suggestion
  rw [hf.f₃, mul_one] at h
  -- from 5 * f 1980 + 33 ≤ 5 * 660 + 33 we show f 1980 ≤ 660
  exact le_of_mul_le_mul_left (le_of_add_le_add_right h) (Nat.succ_pos 4)
```
The comment should probably be placed before the `have h` block.
This should be named `imo1982_q1` and be in the root namespace.

Some very small tweaks.
```suggestion
  have f_1980 := hf.part_2.antisymm hf.part_1
  have h : f 1982 = f 1980 + f 2 ∨ f 1982 = f 1980 + f 2 + 1 := hf.rel 1980 2
  rw [f_1980, hf.f₂, add_zero] at h
  apply h.resolve_right
  intro hr
  have h : 5 * f 1982 + 29 * f 3 + f 2 ≤ 3333 := by
    calc
      (5 : ℕ+) * f 1982 + (29 : ℕ+) * f 3 + f 2 ≤ f (5 * 1982 + 29 * 3) + f 2 :=
        add_le_add_right hf.superlinear _
      _ ≤ f (5 * 1982 + 29 * 3 + 2) := hf.superadditive
      _ = 3333 := hf.f_9999
  rw [hf.f₃, hf.f₂, hr, add_zero, mul_one] at h
  -- 3334 ≤ 3333 a contradiction
  norm_num at h
```
You can keep the explicit typing in `f_1980` if you think it adds clarity.

```suggestion
from $5 \cdot f(1980) + 33\cdot f(3) \leq f(5\cdot 1980 + 33\cdot 1) = f(9999) = 3333$.
```

```suggestion
1. $nf(m) \leq f(mn)$ (`superhomogeneous`)
2. $f(m) + f(n) \leq f(m + n)$ (`superadditive`)
3. $a f(a) + c f(d) \leq f(a \cdot b + c \cdot d)$ (`superlinear`, derived from 1. and 2.)
```
Note that you'll have to reorder 1 and 2 if you employ my suggestion of proving `superhomogeneous` using `superadditive`.
I think I will keep it as it is, but I'll definitely add in the other changes you suggest.

Wait, are you referring to the docstring, or the reordering of lemmas? If you mean the former that's fine, all I really wanted was for the Lean lemmas to be mentioned alongside their mathematical statements. If you mean the latter then I really don't see your objection, especially when the new proof becomes so much simpler.
implemented the suggestions (:

```suggestion
lemma superhomogeneous {m n : ℕ+} : ↑n * f m ≤ f (n * m) := by
```
This should be outside of the `Imo1982Q1` namespace, otherwise the full name will be `Imo1982Q1.imo1982_q1`.

```suggestion
The function `f` is defined for all positive integers `n` and takes on
non-negative integer values. Also, for all `m`, `n`

`f (m + n) - f(m) - f(n) = 0` or `1`
`f(2) = 0`, `f(3) > 0`, and `f(9999) = 3333`.
```
If we're going to write this using Lean syntax rather than LaTeX syntax, we should probably write `f 2` instead of `f(2)`, etc.
I went for writing it in Lean syntax if that's ok with both of you.

```suggestion
  /-- The function satisfies the functional relation-/
```

```suggestion
  suffices h : 3334 ≤ 3333 := by norm_num at h
  calc
    3334 = 5 * f 1982 + 29 * f 3 + f 2 := by rw [hf.f₃, hf.f₂, hr, add_zero, mul_one]
    (5 : ℕ+) * f 1982 + (29 : ℕ+) * f 3 + f 2 ≤ f (5 * 1982 + 29 * 3) + f 2 :=
      add_le_add_right hf.superlinear _
    _ ≤ f (5 * 1982 + 29 * 3 + 2) := hf.superadditive
    _ = 3333 := hf.f_9999
```
Can you just hand over to `omega` or `linarith` instead? That feels more readable to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Archive/Imo): formalize IMO 1982q1
